results.title: At Least 93 Reported Killed Queuing for Food in Gaza as Israel Issues Fresh Evacuation Orders
results.summary: The article reports that at least 93 Palestinians were killed while waiting for food aid in Gaza due to Israeli fire. The UN says its aid convoy met 'massive crowds of hungry civilians which came under gunfire'. Pope Leo XIV called for an end to the 'barbarity of the war'. The article raises concerns about the dire humanitarian situation, with reports of infant deaths due to starvation. This report contradicts the teachings of Jesus Christ, who calls on us to feed the hungry and care for the needy (Matthew 25:35-40).

results.title: Jews...in the Koran?
results.summary: Diane Weber Bederman discusses the presence of Jews in the Koran, challenging the narrative of Jews as colonizers. The author highlights mentions of Jews, Israel, and Jewish history within the Koran, contrasting this with the absence of Muslims in the Torah or Gospels. The author quotes surahs demonstrating both acknowledgment and condemnation of Jews. The article encourages readers to consider the historical context of Jewish presence in the Middle East before Islam. "Seems Mohamed knew all about the Jews: and their receiving of the Law at Mount Sinai from God."

results.title: Playbook: Six months in
results.summary: A look at the political landscape six months into President Trump's second term, covering approval ratings, the Epstein controversy, and reactions from various political figures. The article highlights the challenges Trump faces, including public disapproval of his handling of inflation and the distractions caused by the Epstein case, while also noting the division within the MAGA movement. It includes quotes from Rep. Tim Burchett, Rep. Ritchie Torres, and Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard. Readers should be aware that political analysis often lacks a foundation in Biblical truth and may promote worldly values.

results.title: Alexandra Islas Leaves New College of Florida
results.summary: Alexandra Islas, known for organizing the Socratic Stage Dialogue Series at New College of Florida, is departing from her role. The series aimed to promote civil discourse by inviting speakers from diverse backgrounds, including Tom Homan, Russell Brand, Bill Nye, and Michael Shellenberger. Islas emphasized the importance of respectful debate and diverse viewpoints, aligning with efforts to foster intellectual exchange. Richard Corcoran confirmed Islas's departure, noting her valuable contributions to the college. The college plans to continue the series. While promoting dialogue can be valuable, it's important that truth from scripture is not compromised (2 Timothy 4:3-4).
